abstract.text: This article describes the KeyboardKit layout engine.

inlineContent.text: The keyboard layout of a software keyboard can vary between locales and devices, which means that a layout engine must be flexible.
is used to define the full set of keys to add to a keyboard. A keyboard layout can be created from an
, which just defines the input keys and allows us to reuse identical layouts for many compatible input sets.
unlocks more input sets, like QWERTZ, and AZERTY, as well as localized input sets and layouts for all
locales in your license. More information about Pro features can be found further down.

inlineContent.text: You can use the convenient layout functions that KeyboardKit provides to insert, remove, replace, and modify items within the layout.

locales that are included in your license.
KeyboardKit Pro will automatically set up all input sets and layout services in your license, and use them when you change
. You can also use them individually, as standalone features:
These input sets and services will throw a license error if you try to access them without first registering a valid KeyboardKit Pro license.

abstract.text: A keyboard layout input set defines which input keys
to add to a keyboard layout.
